page.title: 06HERB NURSERY
page.content:
Our group from Newhall Primary School visited Poyntzfield Herb Nursery which used to be part of the kitchen garden of Poyntzfield House. This was built in 1857 and the garden which is about three quarters of an acre in size was then used to grow vegetables for the big house. The nursery is only about half of the original kitchen garden, the other half is left to grow wild just now. We found out that Mr. Ross grows over 300 plants and herbs as well as vegetables for the restaurant in the big house. Some of the plants are grown from seed, others are grown from cuttings. We were very surprised to find that some seeds came from as far away as Germany, Ireland, America, China, Canada, India and other countries.
continued on page 7
